advert.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> 1980 RANGE ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>Advert said:<br><br> <font color="#666666">Choose from three computer systems:<br> The H-89 All-In-One Computer gives you everything in one compact, convenient unit.<br> The flexible H8 gives you the freedom to combine memory and interfacing for exactly the system you require.<br> And the powerful H11A gives you 16-bit power for your most complex programs.<br> The Heathkit line includes video terminals, matrix and letter quality printers, and accessories. You'll even find award-winning self-instruction packages to teach yourself programming in Basic or Assembly.</font></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> CHARLIE CHAPLIN #2</strong></font><br><blockquote>1982 - It was the time when one still lacked good programs for the IBM PC...<br><br> Advert said: <font color="#666666"><br><br> Attention, all programmers. Here's a chance to reach the top.<br> If you've written software that's completed and runs on the IBM Personal Computer (or another computer), we could be interested in publishing it...<br> ... We select programs that will make the IBM Personal Computer an even more useful toll for modern times...</font></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> BRAZILIAN ADVERT (1985)</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to <a href="http://www.mci.org.br" target="_blank">Museu da Computação e Informática - MCI</a> for this picture.</p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> JAPANESE ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to <a href="http://mayura.jp/blog" target="_blank">Mayura Labo</a> for this picture</p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> FRENCH ADVERT</strong></font><br><blockquote>''Each day, go on the computing road''</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> 6000 MODEL</strong></font><br><blockquote>Advert says:<br><font color="#666666"> WE HAVE A NEW APPROACH TO DISTRIBUTED PROCESSING THAT WORKS <br><br> Already implemented are electronic mail, word processing, complete cost accounting with inventory control and more. The secret is a new technology called Functionally Structured Distribution (FSD). At last, a system to organize and manage distributed processing applications that is really up and running. FSD technology is especially applicable to installa­tions that require:<br> • Unlimited expandability supporting extremely large data bases and terminals in many cities.<br> • User-friendly software easily programmed in high level languages (COBOL, FORTRAN, and BASIC)<br> • System reliability (due to distributed hardware) while maintaining multiple levels of data security.<br> • Compatibility with existing mainframes and networks (including the Bell System). <br><br> We are presently installing Billings 6000 Computer Systems which take full advantage of distributed processing utilizing FSD technology. The 6000 Computer supports multiple hard disk drives with capacities of up to 64 Mbytes (formatted), streaming tapes for backup, auto-dial modems (2400 baud synchronous) for communications, and flexible disk drives for smaller installations.</font></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> US AD (JULY, 1983)</strong></font><br><blockquote><p class="petitgris">Thanks to Eric Buczynski for this advert</p></blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> COMMERCIAL PAMPHLET - PAGE #1</strong></font><br><blockquote>... from Australia<p class="petitgris">thanks to Richard Rogers</p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> NORTHSTAR BROCHURE #2</strong></font><br><blockquote>NorthStar brochure - Page 2 <b>EXPANSION OPTIONS</b><br><br> <b>HRAM.64</b> - High Speed 64Kb Dynamic RAM memory board with parity (up to a total of six)<br> <b>HSIO.4</b> - Four Serial Port Expansion Board (RS-232C or Current Loop).<br> <b>FPB</b> - Floating Point Arithmetic Board.<br> <b>ADC-2D</b> - Two additionaI 5 1/4 inch Double capacity floppy disk drives incorporated within a cabinet (360 Kb total capacity).<br> <b>ADC-2Q</b> - Two additionaI 5 1/4 inch Quad capacity floppy disk drives incorporated within a cabinet (720 Kb total capacity).<br> <b>HDS-5</b> - 5 1/4 inch Winchester Hard Disk 5 Mb formatted capacity.<br> <b>HDS-18</b> - 14 inch Winchester Hard Disk 18 Mb formatted capacity.<br> <b>Tape Backup</b> - 13.4 Mb Tape Backup system for HDS-18 or HDS-5.<br> <b>CRT</b> - Hazeltine 1420/Soroc 120. (Other software drivers available.)<br> <b>Printer</b> - 35 or 55 cps letter quality printer. <p class="petitgris">Thanks to <b>Gordon Dyer</b> from England </p></blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> 1ST. U.S. ADVERT #1</strong></font><br><blockquote>The first Epson QX-10 advert appeared in January 1983. It took eight pages and explained the advantages of the Valdoc system, the benefits of the CP/M operating system compatibility, and the advanced hardware concepts. <br><br> In conclusion, it said: <br><br><font color="#666666"> <b>The most important component is you</b><br> You don't buy a computer for how "smart" it is. You buy one for how smart it makes you.<br> The Epson QX-10 was conceived, designed, engineered and built with just one thought in mind: to vastly expand your ability to see, to think, to create with a system that acts as a natural extension of the human mind.<br> The QX-10 is not a computer designed to play games, although it plays games as well as any and better than most.<br> It's a computer for people who think.<br> And who want to think better.</font></blockquote>

computer.description:
The FM-77AV40SX was the last FM-77 series machine, Audio-Visual expansion of FM-77AV40EX.
About this computer, Nomura Hisayuki adds: Some people said FM77AV40SX was the ultimate 8 bit computer. (Other people said that Hitachi S1 was this one.) Its video-functions were remarkable. - displays TV programs on it's video monitor, - TV control from the keyboard, - TV screen capture, - displays subtitles on TV. These functions were realized in the 80s! 260,000 color graphics was also marvelous.
The case colour which looked like the stone was beautiful. A lot of people called FM77AVSX a "tombstone". This PC was the last FM77 machine. So, FM77AV became a real tombstone of FM77.
computer.graphics: 640 x 400 8 colours x 2 pages - 640 x 200 8 colours x 4 pages
computer.keyboard: Full stroke keyboard JIS type with numeric keypad
computer.name: FM 77 AV SX
computer.ports: 1 I/O slot, RS-232C, Printer, Joystick, mouse, Analog RGB
computer.ram: 192 KB , Max 448 KB (40SX)128 KB , Max 192 KB (20SX)
